congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 4923, amended, to establish a process for the submission and consideration of petitions for temporary duty suspensions and reductions, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas to 2 nays, Roll No. 166;

extension.searchTitle: EMAIL PRIVACY ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 65

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 699, amended, to amend title 18, United States Code, to update the privacy protections for electronic communications information that is stored by third-party service providers in order to protect consumer privacy interests while meeting law enforcement needs, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 419 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 167; and

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4498, HELPING ANGELS LEAD OUR STARTUPS ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4498, HELPING ANGELS LEAD OUR STARTUPS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 65

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Helping Angels Lead Our Startups Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4498, to clarify the definition of general solicitation under Federal securities law, by a yea-and-nay vote of 325 yeas to 89 nays, Roll No. 171.<P/>Maxine Waters (CA) amendment (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 114-530) that sought to limit the types of fees ``demo day'' sponsors can collect, limit attendance at ``demo days'' to only individuals with financial sophistication, and require an issuer to be a real business (by a yea-and-nay vote of 139 yeas to 272 nays, Roll No. 170).<P/>H. Res. 701, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4498) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 240 ayes to 177 noes, Roll No. 169, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 168.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Helping Angels Lead Our Startups Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4498, to clarify the definition of general solicitation under Federal securities law, by a yea-and-nay vote of 325 yeas to 89 nays, Roll No. 171.<P/>Maxine Waters (CA) amendment (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 114-530) that sought to limit the types of fees ``demo day'' sponsors can collect, limit attendance at ``demo days'' to only individuals with financial sophistication, and require an issuer to be a real business (by a yea-and-nay vote of 139 yeas to 272 nays, Roll No. 170).<P/>H. Res. 701, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4498) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 240 ayes to 177 noes, Roll No. 169, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 168.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4498, to clarify the definition of general solicitation under Federal securities law, by a yea-and-nay vote of 325 yeas to 89 nays, Roll No. 171.<P/>Maxine Waters (CA) amendment (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 114-530) that sought to limit the types of fees ``demo day'' sponsors can collect, limit attendance at ``demo days'' to only individuals with financial sophistication, and require an issuer to be a real business (by a yea-and-nay vote of 139 yeas to 272 nays, Roll No. 170).<P/>H. Res. 701, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4498) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 240 ayes to 177 noes, Roll No. 169, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 168.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Helping Angels Lead Our Startups Act

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>S. 1890, to amend chapter 90 of title 18, United States Code, to provide Federal jurisdiction for the theft of trade secrets, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 410 yeas to 2 nays, Roll No. 172.
